tasks.name: Security Configuration Restoration
tasks.description: Create comprehensive security_config section in config.yaml to enable authentication and authorization. Currently missing security_config causes SecurityLayer.enable_auth to default to False, completely bypassing all security checks.
tasks.notes: CRITICAL: This is the root cause of authentication bypass. All security depends on this configuration existing.

relatedFiles.description: Add security_config section with authentication settings

tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Add security_config section to /home/kali/Desktop/AutoBot/config/config.yaml with:
- enable_auth: true
- allowed_users with password_hash entries
- roles with proper permission matrices
- audit_log_file configuration
2. Update config.yaml.template with same security_config
3. Ensure SecurityLayer and AuthMiddleware can load configuration
4. Test configuration loading in SecurityLayer constructor
tasks.verificationCriteria: SecurityLayer.enable_auth returns True, allowed_users and roles loaded properly, audit_log_file configured, authentication no longer bypassed
tasks.analysisResult: CRITICAL P0 SECURITY AUDIT: Restore temporarily disabled security features in AutoBot platform. Multiple security systems are currently bypassed including authentication, file permissions, input validation, API security, and command execution sandboxing. Immediate remediation required to prevent unauthorized access and system compromise.
tasks.summary: CRITICAL SECURITY VULNERABILITY FIXED: Successfully restored authentication by adding comprehensive security_config section to config.yaml. Authentication bypass eliminated - enable_auth now returns True, all security layers properly configured with bcrypt password hashes, role-based permissions, and audit logging. SecurityLayer and AuthMiddleware both confirm authentication is enabled. Validation tests pass completely.
